title: Linguine with Clam Sauce Recipe
description: Linguini with clam sauce is a quick and easy Italian dinner. The garlicky sauce is made with canned clams in butter, oil, parsley, and basil.

Linguine with Clam Sauce 4.5 (403) 330 Reviews 31 Photos This linguine with clam sauce is an easy, inexpensive meal. Try the clam sauce over any pasta; lemon-pepper linguine is especially tasty. You can stretch the sauce for larger portions by adding 1/2 cup of chicken broth. Submitted by Dorothy Rinaldi Updated on November 12, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 31 31 31 31 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 (16 ounce) package linguini pasta 2 (6.5 ounce) cans minced clams, with juice ½ cup vegetable oil ¼ cup butter 1 tablespoon dried parsley ¼ tablespoon dried basil ½ teaspoon minced garlic ground black pepper to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook linguine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes. Drain. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios While the pasta is cooking, combine clams with juice, oil, butter, parsley, basil, garlic, and pepper in a large saucepan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook over medium heat until boiling. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve warm clam sauce over pasta. Add Your Photo Photos of Linguine with Clam Sauce 01 of 31 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 31 Photo by  Lisa F 01/23/2021 03 of 31 Photo by  Lori 12/20/2020 The only thing I changed was that I added about 1/2 cup of fresh shredded Parmesan cheese. That put it over the top to 5 stars for me. As written, it’s a solid 4 stars. Simple, delicious, and comes together fast! Can’t wait to see how it holds up as leftovers tomorrow. 04 of 31 Photo by  Michelle Woods 10/15/2020 This recipe was yummilious! I took the advise of another user and used olive oil instead of vegetable oil. I also add Parmesan cheese as she recommended to thicken! Ooh my!!! Yummilious! Thank you! 05 of 31 Photo by  Corey Michaud 10/10/2020 06 of 31 Photo by  Stephanie Scarglia 09/16/2020 07 of 31 Photo by  Anamite Menguito Anama 07/30/2020 08 of 31 Photo by  Jenna 06/20/2020 This was absolutely delicious! So easy and tasty. I used oregano instead of basil and it turned out great. This is definitely a recipe I’ll be making again and again! 09 of 31 Photo by  Jesse Hornblum 02/29/2020 Delicious! Will definitely make again for company. I added some extra garlic and used 3/4 cup fresh parsley instead of 1 tablespoon dried. Also used 1/4 cup olive oil instead of vegetable oil like others suggested.
